text: have strucken him with a cudgel, and yet my mind

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: gave me his clothes made a false report of him.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: What an arm he has! He turned me

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: about with his finger and his thumb as one would

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: set up a top.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: Nay, I knew by his face that there

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: was something in him. He had, sir, a kind of face,

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: methought—I cannot tell how to term it.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: He had so, looking as it were—

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: Would I were hanged but I thought there was

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: more in him than I could think.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: So did I, I’ll be sworn. He is simply

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: the rarest man i’ th’ world.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: I think he is. But a greater soldier

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: than he you wot one.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: Who, my master?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: Nay, it’s no matter for that.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: Worth six on him.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: Nay, not so neither. But I take him

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: to be the greater soldier.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: Faith, look you, one cannot tell

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: how to say that. For the defense of a town our general

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: is excellent.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: Ay, and for an assault too.

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: O slaves, I can tell you news, news,

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: you rascals!

speaker: BOTH
text: What, what, what? Let’s partake!

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: I would not be a Roman, of all nations;

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: I had as lief be a condemned man.

speaker: BOTH
text: Wherefore? Wherefore?

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: Why, here’s he that was wont to

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: thwack our general, Caius Martius.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: Why do you say “thwack our

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: general”?

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: I do not say “thwack our general,”

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: but he was always good enough for him.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: Come, we are fellows and friends.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: He was ever too hard for him; I have heard him

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: say so himself.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: He was too hard for him directly, to

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: say the truth on ’t, before Corioles; he scotched

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: him and notched him like a carbonado.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: An he had been cannibally given,

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: he might have boiled and eaten him too.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: But, more of thy news.

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: Why, he is so made on here within

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: as if he were son and heir to Mars; set at upper end

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: o’ th’ table; no question asked him by any of the

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: senators but they stand bald before him. Our general

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: himself makes a mistress of him, sanctifies

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: himself with ’s hand, and turns up the white o’ th’

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: eye to his discourse. But the bottom of the news is,

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: our general is cut i’ th’ middle and but one half of

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: what he was yesterday, for the other has half, by

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: the entreaty and grant of the whole table. He’ll go,

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: he says, and sowl the porter of Rome gates by th’

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: ears. He will mow all down before him and leave

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: his passage polled.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: And he’s as like to do ’t as any

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: man I can imagine.

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: Do ’t? He will do ’t! For, look you,

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: sir, he has as many friends as enemies, which

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: friends, sir, as it were, durst not, look you, sir, show

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: themselves, as we term it, his friends whilest he’s

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: in directitude.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: Directitude? What’s that?

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: But when they shall see, sir, his

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: crest up again, and the man in blood, they will out

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: of their burrows like coneys after rain, and revel

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: all with him.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: But when goes this forward?

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: Tomorrow, today, presently. You

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: shall have the drum struck up this afternoon. ’Tis,

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: as it were, a parcel of their feast, and to be executed

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: ere they wipe their lips.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: Why then, we shall have a stirring

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: world again. This peace is nothing but to rust iron,

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: increase tailors, and breed ballad-makers.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: Let me have war, say I. It exceeds

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: peace as far as day does night. It’s sprightly walking,

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: audible, and full of vent. Peace is a very apoplexy,

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: lethargy; mulled, deaf, sleepy, insensible; a getter

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: of more bastard children than war’s a destroyer of

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: men.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: ’Tis so, and as wars in some sort

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: may be said to be a ravisher, so it cannot be denied

speaker:
SECOND
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: but peace is a great maker of cuckolds.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: Ay, and it makes men hate one

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: another.

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: Reason: because they then less

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: need one another. The wars for my money! I hope

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: to see Romans as cheap as Volscians.

speaker:
THIRD
               
              SERVINGMAN
text: They are rising; they are rising.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              AND
               
              SECOND
               
              SERVINGMEN
text: In, in, in, in!
